alert.note: Alert for Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 6:47PM EDT until September 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Portage and Summit. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Cuyahoga Falls, Kent, Green, Hudson, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Mogadore, Stow, Aurora, Brimfield, Fairlawn, Munroe Falls, Lakemore, Silver Lake, Boston Heights, Sugar Bush Knolls, Portage Lakes and Montrose-Ghent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
